1.name: Citizen Kane
1.description: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance.

2.name: How Green Was My Valley
2.description: At the turn of the century in a Welsh mining village, the Morgans, he stern, she gentle, raise coal-mining sons and hope their youngest will find a better life.

3.name: The Feminine Touch
3.description: John Hathaway is a professor of psychology at Digby College. His students are bored as he is with the students. He leaves college to go to New York to have his manuscript on jealousy ...                See full summary »

4.name: Dumbo
4.description: Ridiculed because of his enormous ears, a young circus elephant is assisted by a mouse to achieve his full potential.

5.name: The Maltese Falcon
5.description: A private detective takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar, and their quest for a priceless statuette.

6.name: That Uncertain Feeling
6.description: A psychoanalyst causes a woman to doubt her happy marriage.

7.name: Adventures of Captain Marvel
7.description: To protect a magic talisman from being used for evil, a teenage boy named Billy Batson is given the power to become an adult superhero, Captain Marvel, with a single magic word: "Shazam!"

8.name: Sullivan's Travels
8.description: A director of escapist films goes on the road as a hobo to learn about life, which gives him a rude awakening.

9.name: Suspicion
9.description: A shy young heiress marries a charming gentleman, and soon begins to suspect he is planning to murder her.

10.name: The Wolf Man
10.description: A practical man returns to his homeland, is attacked by a creature of folklore, and infected with a horrific disease his disciplined mind tells him can not possibly exist.

11.name: High Sierra
11.description: After being released from prison, notorious thief Roy Earle is hired by his old boss to help a group of inexperienced criminals plan and carry out the robbery of a California resort.

12.name: Sergeant York
12.description: A marksman is drafted in World War I and ends up becoming one of the most celebrated war heroes.

13.name: Shadows on the Stairs
13.description: Occupants of a London boarding house become suspects as a string of murders are discovered.

14.name: The Lady Eve
14.description: A trio of classy card sharks targets the socially awkward heir to brewery millions for his money, until one of them falls in love with him.

15.name: Penny Serenade
15.description: A couple's big dreams give way to a life full of unexpected sadness and unexpected joy.

16.name: The Little Foxes
16.description: The ruthless, moneyed Hubbard clan lives in, and poisons, their part of the deep South at the turn of the twentieth century.

17.name: Ball of Fire
17.description: A group of professors working on a new encyclopedia encounter a mouthy nightclub singer who is wanted by the police to help bring down her mob boss lover.

18.name: Meet John Doe
18.description: A man needing money agrees to impersonate a nonexistent person who said he'd be committing suicide as a protest, and a political movement begins.

19.name: Topper Returns
19.description: A fun-loving young woman finds herself murdered after trading bedrooms with her wealthy friend. Her ghost seeks aid from a banker to find out why and by whom.

20.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
20.description: Dr. Jekyll allows his dark side to run wild when he drinks a potion that turns him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

21.name: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
21.description: A couple who have been married for three years are shocked to learn that their marriage is not legally valid.

22.name: Ziegfeld Girl
22.description: Discovery by Flo Ziegfeld changes a girl's life but not necessarily for the better, as three beautiful women find out when they join the spectacle on Broadway: Susan, the singer who must ...                See full summary »

23.name: Tobacco Road
23.description: Hillbilly family life in 1941 rural Georgia.

24.name: Moon Over Miami
24.description: Sisters Kay and Barbara arrive in Miami from Texas looking for rich husbands.

25.name: Blood and Sand
25.description: Illiterate peasant Juan Gallardo rises meteorically to fame and fortune in the bullfight arena only to sow the seeds of his own fall.

26.name: Sun Valley Serenade
26.description: When Phil Corey's band arrives at the Idaho ski resort its pianist Ted Scott is smitten with a Norwegian refugee he has sponsored, Karen Benson. When soloist Vivian Dawn quits, Karen stages an ice show as a substitute.

27.name: The Bride Came C.O.D.
27.description: A financially-strapped charter pilot hires himself to an oil tycoon to kidnap his madcap daughter and prevent her from marrying a vapid band leader.

28.name: The Great Lie
28.description: After a newlywed's husband apparently dies in a plane crash, she discovers that her rival for his affections is now pregnant with his child.

29.name: The Reluctant Dragon
29.description: Humorist Robert Benchley learns about the animation process at Walt Disney Studios while trying to find the great man himself to pitch him the idea of making a cartoon about a shy dragon.

30.name: That Hamilton Woman
30.description: The story of courtesan and dance-hall girl Emma Hamilton, including her relationships with Sir William Hamilton and Admiral Horatio Nelson and her rise and fall, set during the Napoleonic Wars.

31.name: They Died with Their Boots On
31.description: A highly fictionalized account of the life of George Armstrong Custer from his arrival at West Point in 1857 to his death at the battle of the Little Big Horn in 1876. He has little ...                See full summary »

32.name: Here Comes Mr. Jordan
32.description: Boxer Joe Pendleton dies 50 years too soon due to a heavenly mistake, and is given a new life as a millionaire playboy.

33.name: Kipps
33.description: Kipps the draper's apprentice falls in love with a girl above his station. When he unexpectedly inherits a fortune, he thinks his dream has come true. But money can't make him a gentleman, or bring him the girl he really wants...

34.name: The Shanghai Gesture
34.description: In Shanghai, dragon-lady 'Mother' Gin Sling operates a gambling house for wealthy patrons but she clashes with influential land developer Sir Guy Charteris who wants to put her out-of-business.

35.name: I Wake Up Screaming
35.description: Why is Inspector Ed Cornell trying to railroad Frankie Christopher for the murder of model Vicky Lynn?

36.name: Man Hunt
36.description: British hunter Thorndike vacationing in Bavaria has Hitler in his gun sight. He is captured, beaten, left for dead, and escapes back to London where he is hounded by German agents and aided by a young woman.

37.name: All That Money Can Buy
37.description: A nineteenth-century New Hampshire farmer who makes a pact with Satan for economic success enlists Daniel Webster to extract him from his contract.

38.name: Never Give a Sucker an Even Break
38.description: Fields wants to sell a film story to Esoteric Studios. On the way he gets insulted by little boys, beat up for ogling a woman, and abused by a waitress. He becomes his niece's guardian when...                See full summary »

39.name: Shadow of the Thin Man
39.description: Nick and Nora are at their wisecracking best as they investigate murder and racketeering at a local race track.

40.name: The Devil and Miss Jones
40.description: A tycoon goes undercover to ferret out agitators at a department store, but gets involved in their lives instead.

41.name: Adam Had Four Sons
41.description: A governess becomes the center of a wealthy family after her employer's wife dies.

42.name: Pot o' Gold
42.description: Jimmy, the owner of a failed music shop, goes to work with his uncle, the owner of a food factory. Before he gets there, he befriends an Irish family who happens to be his uncle's worst ...                See full summary »

43.name: Johnny Eager
43.description: The daughter of a district attorney falls in love with a gangster who her father is trying to have imprisoned.

44.name: You'll Never Get Rich
44.description: In order to cover up his philandering ways, a married Broadway producer sets one of his dancers up on a date with a chorus girl for whom he had bought a gift, but the two dancers fall in love for real.

45.name: Two-Faced Woman
45.description: After a ski instructor catches her husband flirting with an old flame, she decides to pose as her (fictitious) twin sister in an attempt to keep him faithful.

46.name: Riders of the Purple Sage
46.description: Lassiter discovers the judge (Barrat) who cheated his neice of her inheritance leads a gang of badguys posing as vigilantes.

47.name: Hold That Ghost
47.description: After inheriting a fortune from a gangster, two dim-witted service station attendants find themselves stranded in a haunted house.

48.name: Great Guns
48.description: Laurel and Hardy join the army. They are hardly soldiers, but they believe their employer will need them now he's drafted.

49.name: Genroku Chûshingura
49.description: In 1701, Lord Takuminokami Asano has a feud with Lord Kira and he tries to kill Kira in the corridors of the Shogun's palace. The Shogun sentences Lord Asano to commit suppuku and deprives ...                See full summary »

50.name: Sundown
50.description: In 1941, a mysterious Somaliland native woman helps the British against the Nazis.
